summary: Scope expanded from a primarily informational portal UI into a fully functional SMART JANGHAI Admin Dashboard web application requiring real backend + database capabilities, including authentication, role-based access control, and CRUD management for multiple content domains (users, news, schemes, jobs, media, notifications, settings, reports/analytics, backup/security), while retaining the Deep Blue/Orange glassmorphism government-portal design system.
architectural_notes: Homepage hero image must reference the exact web-safe filename under /public/assets/generated; keep code path in sync with the actual asset name.
If adding images to the logo/branding area, ensure responsive sizing and preserve readability/spacing across common screen sizes.
Front page branding should show only one logo/mark; avoid duplicating logos across hero/logo section and other areas.
If the brand name text is replaced by a logo image, ensure accessibility: provide meaningful alt text and preserve layout/readability across breakpoints.
Branding direction update: display ‚ÄúSmart Janghai‚Äù as a text logo and set its color to white in the hero/header; ensure readability with the existing overlay/contrast handling.
Theme direction update: use Deep Blue (#0A3D62) and Orange (#F57C00) as primary colors with glassmorphism/soft shadows; ensure accessibility contrast and responsive behavior across breakpoints.
Add new routes/pages for Member Login and User Dashboard; keep layouts responsive and consistent with shared theme components (navbars/sidebars/cards/forms).

New scope request: implement a real, working Admin Dashboard requiring backend persistence, authentication/session management, and role-based access control (Super Admin/Editor/Moderator) with CRUD across multiple modules; verify feasibility with the platform-supported stack before committing implementation direction.
known_issues: Hero image not displaying due to mismatch between referenced filename (chatgpt-image-feb-14-2026-115631-am-1.png) and actual uploaded asset name (ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png).
Build/deploy failed with a configuration error ("Please reach out to the Caffeine team").
After latest deployment/update, the site appears blank/"nothing is showing" (possible build/runtime failure or missing render).
Admin panel not showing / admin options not visible (user reports admin dashboard not rendering or menu/options missing).

existing_features.title: Build the public homepage for the informational website named ‚ÄúSmart Janghai‚Äù, including a hero section that prominently displays the brand name ‚ÄúSMART JANGHAI‚Äù and a short informational tagline, plus a simple layout for additional informational sections (e.g., intro, highlights, footer).
Add and display a generated homepage hero image as a static frontend asset, stored under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use it as the hero background/primary visual on the homepage.

Apply a cohesive, modern visual theme for the Smart Janghai informational site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) and enforce it consistently across the homepage. Do not use a blue-and-purple dominant palette.

Update the HomePage top (hero) section to display the uploaded image behind the "SMART JANGHAI" logo/text at the top of the front page, preserving readability (e.g., via existing gradient overlay) across common screen sizes.

Add the newly uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM-1.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and ensure the homepage hero references that exact filename.

Ensure the top (hero) section of the front page displays the uploaded image behind the "SMART JANGHAI" logo/text while preserving text readability across common screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop), using an overlay/gradient if needed.

Fix the HomePage hero background image so it loads correctly by making the referenced `src` path match the actual static asset filename under `frontend/public/assets/generated`, specifically the user-uploaded file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png" (use a web-safe filename in the generated assets folder and ensure `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx` references that exact web-safe filename).

Add the user-uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 12_12_09 PM.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and ensure the app references that exact filename.

Update the HomePage hero "logo section" (the branding area in the hero content) to display the uploaded image (from REQ-9) alongside/above the "SMART JANGHAI" text while preserving readability and responsive layout (mobile/tablet/desktop).
Fix the frontend so the Smart Janghai site reliably renders content again (no blank page) after deployment.
Remove the duplicate React Query provider setup so the app uses exactly one QueryClientProvider (keep the provider in frontend/src/main.tsx and update frontend/src/App.tsx accordingly).

Add a user-visible error fallback for unexpected render/runtime errors so the page never appears completely blank (e.g., an Error Boundary around the app that displays a simple English error message and a refresh action).

Verify the hero and logo static image asset paths are valid and do not break page rendering; ensure frontend/src/assets/generatedAssets.ts references files that exist under frontend/public/assets/generated, and make image loading resilient (do not let missing images blank the page).

Add the user-uploaded image file "LOGO.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and update the code to reference that exact filename for the site logo.

Update the homepage hero branding area so the front page displays only one logo/branding mark (no multiple logos). Use the uploaded logo image as the single logo displayed in the hero, and remove/avoid any additional logo images so only one logo is shown.
Add a Support section at the bottom of the website (in the footer area) that displays the contact email address "SMARTCARE01@GMAIL.COM" in English, as a clickable mailto link.
Replace the visible "SMART JANGHAI" brand-name text used for branding on the site with the existing logo image asset, so the logo image is used as the primary branding mark instead of the text.

Ensure there is only one visible branding logo mark in the hero/branding area at a time and that missing logo assets never cause a blank section or blank page (use the existing resilient image loading pattern).
Remove any visible ‚ÄúSMART JANGHAI‚Äù / ‚ÄúSmart Janghai‚Äù branding text from the UI so the site branding is logo-only (no brand-name text shown in the hero branding area or footer).

Update the BrandLogo component so that if the logo image fails to load, it does not fall back to showing the brand-name text; instead render a non-text fallback that preserves layout and does not cause a blank/empty page.
Add a sliding notification panel on the front page (HomePage) that can be opened and closed by the user.
Populate the sliding notification panel with a small, static set of example notifications stored in the frontend (no backend required), and provide basic interactions.
Ensure the notification panel implementation is resilient and does not introduce blank screens or runtime crashes.
Make all category options on the HomePage (the four feature/category cards: Innovation, Precision, Community, Impact) fully clickable and keyboard-accessible so users can interact with them.

Update the HomePage hero branding to use a text-based logo that displays the brand name "SMART JANGHAI" in white (not an image logo) and ensure it remains readable over the hero background across mobile/tablet/desktop.

Align footer branding with the new text-based logo approach by removing image-logo-only branding in the footer and showing the text logo "SMART JANGHAI" in a style consistent with the site theme (user-facing text in English).

Update the global site theme to match the requested portal branding: Deep Blue (#0A3D62) as the primary color and Orange (#F57C00) as the accent, with a clean, professional, trustworthy ‚Äúgovernment digital portal meets modern tech startup‚Äù look (glassmorphism surfaces, soft shadows, modern typography) applied consistently across the new pages.

Create a new Member Login page UI that matches the provided layout: a centered glassmorphism login card over a full-page blurred aerial view of Janghai town with a soft blue overlay; include top-center text logo ‚ÄúSMART JANGHAI‚Äù and tagline ‚ÄúYour Trusted Information Hub‚Äù above the card.

Implement the Member Login card fields and interactions (UI only; no real authentication required): profile icon at top, Mobile Number input with +91 country code selector, an OTP button, a Password field as an alternative login option, Remember Me checkbox, a Login button with a Deep Blue gradient and hover effect, plus ‚ÄúCreate New Account‚Äù and ‚ÄúForgot Password?‚Äù links.
Add a footer section on the Member Login page that includes the links ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù, ‚ÄúPrivacy Policy‚Äù, and ‚ÄúContact‚Äù, and displays the copyright text exactly as: ‚Äú¬© 2026 SMART JANGHAI‚Äù.

Create a new User Dashboard page UI with a modern admin-style layout: top navigation bar + left sidebar + main content area, styled in the same Deep Blue/Orange portal theme with clean spacing, glassmorphism accents, and soft shadows.

Implement the dashboard UI sections and example content (static/mock data is acceptable): top navbar with SMART JANGHAI logo (left), centered search bar, notification bell icon, and user profile dropdown with items ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù, ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù, ‚ÄúLogout‚Äù; left sidebar menu with icons + text for Dashboard, Latest Updates, Local News, Government Schemes, Education, Jobs, My Profile, Saved Posts, Help & Support (Deep Blue active highlight and smooth hover); main content with welcome section ‚ÄúWelcome back, Ajay üëã‚Äù plus ‚ÄúMember since: 2026‚Äù and a profile completion progress bar; 4 info cards in a row (Latest News Updates, Active Government Schemes, Job Alerts, Saved Articles) each with icon/title/short description/View More button; recent activity list with date, category badge, short description, and Read More link; optional right-side panel with Quick Links and Important Announcements.

Add an Admin Login experience on the frontend using Internet Identity (instead of email/mobile/password/OTP): provide a clear "Sign in with Internet Identity" action, show the signed-in principal and role, and block access to admin modules unless authenticated and authorized.

Extend the existing dashboard UI so every sidebar option is functional by rendering the corresponding admin module views (Dashboard Overview, Manage Users, Manage News, Government Schemes, Jobs, Media Library, Notifications, Website Settings, Reports & Analytics, Backup & Security) within the existing DashboardLayout.

Implement fully working CRUD UI for Users, News, Schemes, and Jobs modules: tables/lists with search/filter, create/edit forms, delete confirmations, and optimistic or refetch-based updates powered by React Query calling the Motoko backend actor.
Implement Media Library UI: upload image/PDF, preview images, list/search media, download/open items, and delete media, integrated with the backend media APIs.
Implement Notifications UI: compose notification, choose target (All Users or Selected Users), send it via backend, and display a list/history of sent notifications.

Implement Website Settings UI: edit Website Name, Tagline, Contact Information, Social Media Links, SEO meta title/description, and change Logo by selecting an item from the Media Library; persist changes via backend settings APIs.
Implement Reports & Analytics UI to visualize backend analytics (daily/monthly traffic, user growth, most viewed posts) and provide CSV export downloads for Users and News.

Implement Backup & Security UI: a backup download button that calls the backend snapshot export, and an Activity Log view that lists admin actions with timestamp and actor principal; include a Login History view based on activity log entries.

Fix admin authorization gating so the Admin Dashboard renders for authenticated admin principals (and is not incorrectly blocked due to mismatched role type comparisons). Update the frontend to correctly interpret the backend `UserRole` value returned by `getCallerUserRole()` and treat the admin role as authorized.

Add a user-visible, non-blank failure state for admin-auth checks when the role query fails (e.g., backend trap, network error, actor unavailable). The admin page must render a clear English error message with a retry action and a 'Back to Home' action instead of staying blank or stuck on an infinite loader.

Ensure there is a clear navigation path to the Admin Login and Admin Dashboard from within the running app UI (not only via internal state changes), so users can reach the admin panel reliably after deployment or refresh.

new_feature_requests.summary: Generate a modern homepage hero image concept for the Smart Janghai informational website with the brand name overlaid.
Place the provided/generated hero image behind the ‚ÄúSMART JANGHAI‚Äù logo/text in the top (hero) section of the front page.

Add the user-uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png" to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, using a web-safe filename, and ensure it is referenced consistently from the homepage hero.
Add the provided images as a sliding notification panel on the front page.
Add the provided image to the logo section of the front page (alongside/within the SMART JANGHAI branding area).
Ensure the front page displays only one logo/branding mark (remove/avoid multiple logos in the hero/branding area).
Add a Support section at the bottom of the homepage/footer area including the contact email SMARTCARE01@GMAIL.COM.
Replace the "SMART JANGHAI" brand name text in the hero/header branding area with the provided image-format logo (use the logo image in place of the text).
Make all category options on the homepage UI clickable (interactive navigation/actions).
Change the visible ‚ÄúSmart Janghai‚Äù name/text color to white in the hero/header branding area.
Use a text-based logo for ‚ÄúSmart Janghai‚Äù (show brand name as text logo rather than an image logo).
Design and implement a Member Login page UI (glassmorphism card, blurred aerial-town background w/ blue overlay, logo + tagline, mobile/OTP + password login options, links, and footer).

Design and implement a User Dashboard layout (top navbar + left sidebar, welcome section, info cards, recent activity list, optional right-side panel) in the specified blue/orange theme with modern admin styling.
Update/define the site theme to use Deep Blue (#0A3D62) and Orange (#F57C00) with glassmorphism, soft shadows, modern typography, and responsive 4K-quality UI styling.
Generate/provide high-resolution (4K) responsive UI mockups for the Member Login page and User Dashboard in the requested style.

Build a fully functional SMART JANGHAI Admin Dashboard system (frontend + backend + database) with secure authentication/session management, role-based access control (Super Admin/Editor/Moderator), and working CRUD with dynamic content updates across Users, News, Government Schemes, Jobs, Media Library, Notifications, Settings, Reports/Analytics, and Backup/Security modules.

Implement backend authentication and role-based access control using Internet Identity principals (no JWT), including roles: Super Admin, Editor, Moderator, and authorization checks on all admin-only and role-restricted operations.

Implement a secure initial bootstrap flow for creating the first Super Admin (e.g., first authenticated principal to call a dedicated bootstrap method becomes Super Admin, and the method becomes permanently disabled afterward).

Implement full CRUD backend APIs (create/read/update/delete + list) and data models for Users management with the fields: Name, Mobile, Email, Role, Status (Active/Inactive), Registration Date, including Activate/Deactivate and role assignment.

Implement full CRUD backend APIs and data models for News posts with fields: Title, Description, Category, Tags, Publish Date, Status (Draft/Published), optional scheduled publish time, and optional Featured Image reference stored in the system media library.

Implement full CRUD backend APIs and data models for Government Schemes with fields: title/name, eligibility details, apply link, important dates, and uploaded documents (PDF) stored in the media library and referenced by id.
Implement full CRUD backend APIs and data models for Jobs with fields: Company Name, Salary, Qualification, Apply Link, Expiry Date, and Active/Expired status derived or stored consistently.

Implement a Media Library backend that supports uploading, listing, searching by filename/type, downloading, and deleting media items for Images and PDFs, including metadata (filename, content type, size, upload timestamp, uploader principal).

Implement a Notifications backend that supports creating notifications targeted to: all users or selected user ids, listing notifications (admin view), and marking as delivered/read state where applicable (admin management).
Implement a Website Settings backend with CRUD/update APIs for: Website Name, Logo reference (media id), Tagline, Contact Information, Social Media Links, and SEO Settings (meta title/description).

Implement Reports & Analytics backend endpoints sufficient to power the admin dashboard: daily/monthly traffic counters, user growth counters, and most viewed posts list, plus an export endpoint that returns CSV for at least Users and News.

Implement Backup & Security backend features: a "backup" export endpoint that returns a complete data snapshot for admin download, and an activity log that records key admin actions (create/update/delete/login/logout/role changes) with timestamp and caller principal.
